Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of removal officer's decision regarding deferral based on best interests of children
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa, had pending PR application, claimed harm to children if removed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Deferral of removal based on family ties and best interests of children
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant with pending permanent residence application
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to leave Canada after visa expiration
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Short-term best interests of children, availability of maternal care and social support
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Request for deferral of removal denied
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Pending PR application, family composition, caregiving arrangements
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to enforcement and removal
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian considerations due to family ties
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Mother’s ability to care for children with support
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Removal officers must consider short-term interests of children but not conduct full H&C assessment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence showing exceptional hardship or inability of mother to care
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential emotional impact on children acknowledged but not deemed sufficient to defer removal
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought delay in removal due to family ties and pending PR application
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered submitted information on family circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No major disputes over evidence authenticity
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Section 44(1) – Authority to remove foreign nationals
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Enforcement of removal order within federal immigration jurisdiction
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer reasonably assessed caregiving capacity of mother
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No obligation for full humanitarian and compassionate assessment at deferral stage; short-term interests addressed

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Violation_Type: Non-compliance with a valid removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of refusal to defer removal under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant remained in Canada after removal order issued, requested deferral due to family hardship
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Deferral of removal based on impact on children
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national subject to removal order
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada despite enforceable removal order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family hardship and best interests of Canadian children
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Short-term welfare of children, availability of alternative caregiver
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative decision to deny deferral
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Family situation, timing of PR application, support network
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on execution of removal orders
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for humanitarian deferral of removal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Capacity of mother to care for children post-removal
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Limited discretion to defer removal; no requirement to assess long-term family hardship
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Recognized emotional impact but deemed manageable
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought deferral citing family ties; request denied
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Considered but not outweighed by compliance with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA – failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Section 55 – Authority to defer removal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Reasonable evaluation of familial support structure
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Officer properly exercised discretion considering relevant factors

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Removal order enforcement vs. humanitarian claims
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether removal officer reasonably denied deferral based on illegal status and family considerations
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Challenge to denial of deferral request
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Best interests of children and pending PR application
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Timing of PR application after removal became enforceable
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPR Regulation 209 – Execution of removal orders
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Scope of humanitarian consideration in deferral decisions
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA allows limited humanitarian consideration in deferral, not full H&C assessment
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to justify exceptional circumstances warranting deferral
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that children's best interests were not adequately weighed
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Federal immigration law and administrative law
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and adequacy of deferral request
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to apply for status regularization earlier
